title: Green Signal Lines
simpleExplanation: These represent CommNet connections between different craft and tracking stations.

advancedExplanations.content: The solid green line mimics the similar green line in-game: It is a measure of the direct connection capability (in contrast to the

The direct connection is calculated from the combined power of all antennae on the craft, which is required for a connection to a tracking station (like the KSC), or a relay satellite. The relay connection is calculated from only the relay type antennae on the craft, this is required for relaying connections from other craft.
Here, probe A has a complete connection through to probe C, because probe B is relaying the connection. If probe C could relay to the KSC, we would have a usable control signal in-game.

advancedExplanations.alt: An image of three satellites connected with green lines.

title: Sphere of Influence Bubbles
simpleExplanation: When dragging craft around, colored bubbles appear around the closest planet or moon. Dropping the craft inside these, will lock it into "orbit" there. Sphere of influence is also known as SOI.

advancedExplanations.content: This allows us to drag the planet around its own orbit, and any craft placed in its SOI will stick close to it. Upon dropping craft in a SOI, it is locked into a position relative to that celestial body.
Sphere of influences constantly overlap: The Mun is inside Kerbin's SOI, while Kerbin is inside Kerbol's SOI. The active SOI is determined by whichever parent body is closest to the craft.

advancedExplanations.alt: An image of a cyan colored bubble around Kerbin.
